intro: Nochotta oleracea, commonly known as garden lettuce, is a member of the Asteraceae family. It is an annual or biennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features basal rosettes of spoon-shaped, smooth, and often hairy leaves. Its flowers are small, yellow, and clustered in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. Nochotta oleracea is cultivated for its edible leaves, which are used in salads and other culinary applications.
